data.title: Video guide to the MOBO Awards at the ECHO Arena
data.meta_description: The MOBO awards are heading to the ECHO Arena on Wednesday - here is our video guide to all of the acts nominated in the biggest categories.
data.text:
The MOBO awards are heading to the ECHO Arena on Wednesday - here is our video guide to all of the acts nominated in the biggest categories.

The MOBO awards are heading to the ECHO Arena on Wednesday - here is our video guide to all of the acts nominated in the biggest categories.

We have tried to use clean versions of the videos and songs, but this was not possible in all cases.

‌

Best Newcomer

Tinie Tempah - It's been a good year for the South London rapper - alongside several hit singles, he leads the way at the MOBO Awards with four nominations.

Professor Green - Stephen Paul Manderson, better known as Professor Green, has had two top-five singles this year - I Need You Tonight ft. Ed Drewett and Just Be Good to Green ft. Lily Allen.

‌

Liverpool Echo Icon

Sign up to FREE email alerts from ECHO Daily News

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you’ve consented to and improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and third parties based on our knowledge of you. More info

Scorcher - London-based grime artist and producer Scorcher has had a successful breakthrough year following the release of his debut album Concrete Jungle at the end of 2009.

Labrinth - Simon Cowell snapped up hip-hop artist and producer Labrinth to his record label Syco, making him his first non-talent show signing in six years. It was a wise move, with Labrinth having scored massive hits with Let the Sun Shine as well as Pass Out and Frisky with Tinie Tempah.

Devlin - Grime artist Devlin is part of the O T Crew and was signed to Island Records/Universal in February of this year. His debut album Bud, Sweat And Beers is scheduled for release later this year.

‌

Best UK R&B/Soul Act

Sade - Helen Folasade Adu achieved fame in the 1980s as the frontwoman of jazz/R&B group Sade. The act released a new album - Soldier of Love - this year, a decade after their previous record.

Natalie Williams - Emerging soul-jazz vocal talent Natalie Williams has a rich musical heritage and released a new album My Oh My this year to critical acclaim.

‌

Corinne Bailey Rae - The Leeds-born singer-songwriting continues to go from strength to strength, with 2010 album The Sea earning her a Mercury Prize nomination and now a shot at a MOBO Award.

McLean - R&B artist McLean has charted twice this year with hit singles My Name and Finally in Love.

Plan B - Rapper, singer, actor - Plan B is a man of varied talents. His second studio album, The Defamation of Strickland Banks, departed from his grime roots and crossed over to great success when released this year.

‌

Best International Act

Drake - Canadian musician and actor Drake has worked with the best - Eminem, Jay-Z, Kanye West - and with album Thank You Later becoming a smash hit across the world this year, his name could soon be up there with them.

Eminem - After last year's Relapse, Eminem released his ninth studio album Recovery in 2010. It was produced by Dr Dre and has so far scored the American rapper three hit singles.

‌

Jason Derulo - Jason Derulo is an American singer, songwriter, dancer and actor. His self-titled debut album was released this year.

Nicki Minaj - American rapper and singer-songwriter Nicki Minaj is due to release debut album Pink Friday later this year, with several hit singles having made it one of the most hotly anticipated hip-hop records of 2010.

Rihanna - The hits continue to flow for R&B sensation Rihanna, with forthcoming 2010 album Loud set to carry on where her previous four records left off.

‌

Best UK Act

Jay Sean - The fourth album from British R&B artist Jay Sean is due for release later this year and the guest artists make for a stellar line-up - Lil Wayne, Pitbull, Nicki Minaj and Mary J Blige.

JLS - British boyband JLS, or Jack the Lad Swing, were runners-up on the X Factor in 2008 and have built on that success since. Their second album, Outta This World, is set to be released in November.

‌

N-Dubz - British hip-hop group N-Dubz have built on the success of 2009 platinum album Against All Odds, touring hard and picking up a BRIT Award nomination.

Taio Cruz - English R&B artist Taio Cruz has had a fantastic year on the back of smash hit Dynamite.
